title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message:
got in a 820-3208 no power no green light,  will not run on battery,  voltage with charger plugged in only,
 r7020 -20v
 r6905 pin 1 -20v pin 2- 2.96v
d6905 pin 1-  0v pin 2- 2.95v pin3 - 2.67v
u5010 pp3v42_g3h - 1.76v
f7040 - ov on ppbus_g3h  

i have tried replacing the isl,  any idea what might be drawing the power down on pp3v42_g3h and why ppbus is not there?  

Thanks 
Nate

title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message: So an 18V voltage drop over R6905, that seems a lot and it must almost be smoking. So either a short on PP3V42 or after R6905.

title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message: bad R6905, check sense resistors on ISl,  R7005, voltage on pin 2 from ISL.........

title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message: no smoke yet hah,  i checked diode mode pp3v42 yesterday i was getting. .4v but after i had replaced the q7055 it seemed i was getting .1v in diode mode on f7040 so there must be a short on pp3v42 is my guess. can i inject voltage on pin 2 of the r6905 and how much can it take?

title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message: What does F7040 have to do with 3V42? Why do you guess there is a short on 3V42, can you not measure?

title: [SOLVED]820-3208 no green light no power
message:
^^ hah sorry didn't realize what i wrote,  or what i had tested yesterday got a flu right now head is all wacky.   checked 3v42 =.321v in diode mode and its good.  ppbus is .16v to ground.  was also good.  replaced the r6905 and everythings working. 
thanks for all the help!
